title: the art of raw
content:
Hi everyone,

Does anybody know what font this is? I love the capital R and how the general look is low and powerfull.

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_en_6533.png)
author: spaaaz

comments.content:
Can't name it and really doubt this is a font as it, more a customization of an existing typeface. I guess you do pretty much the same from many wide/extended grotesk., pulling up/downwards some middle crossbars and reworking /R.  
2 alternatives in the same vein: [Abalda](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/abalda), [Motora Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hubertjocham/motora-sans)  
Candidates for customization: [Novocento Wide Demi Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/synthview/novecento) (probably my choice because /W centre vertex is below the outer strokes), [Engravers Gothic Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/engravers-gothic), [Road Radio](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/glen-jan/road-radio), [Blair Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/blair), [Turnpike](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontdiner/turnpike), [Zeppelin](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/zeppelin), [Doublewide](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/betatype/doublewide), [Reservation Wide](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typetrust/reservation-wide), [Presicav](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/presicav), [Halogen](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/halogen), [Fashion](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/fashion), [Aero](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.vllg.com/Constellation/Aero), [Idlewid](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100043), [Farmers Co-op](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/fonts.kylewaynebenson.com/farmers-co-op)

Wow thanks for all the suggestions! I actually think this is a font but I don't know if it's commercially available. It's used at the end of this video, and also on other materials that they have [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3csaIbOxXjw](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=3csaIbOxXjw "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3csaIbOxXjw")

But I'll go the custom way and modify one of the above for what I need.

Cheers!
Fontname is G-Star New, and I made it on the basis of art-work supplied by G-Star. It's only for internal use.

This is what was originally published by American Type Founders in 1934 as Thermotypes:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ThermoTypes1@ATF1934_3473.jpg)
  
and  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ThermoTypes2@ATF1934_6497.jpg)
  
The mid-line is high in Thermotypes, but it is low in the sample image, except for F, which is high. There is a different W. But the flavor matches the image and the midlines and other differences are easy to edit.  
Don

and it seems to have been digitized;  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/deux-chasses-nf/regular/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017120245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/deux-chasses-nf/regular/)

Thanks for the heads up on Nick's version of Thermotype. Looks good!  
Don
